children.name: to sleep for a short time
take a nap c1
children.definition: have a nap /take a nap  to sleep for a short time during the day:ngủ trưa, ngủ một giấc ngắn
examples: i was having a nap by the fire one evening when i was woken up by the doorbell
try to take a nap in the afternoons if you’re feeling tired.
the director always takes a nap around this time.

children.name: doze x
children.definition: doze to sleep lightly for a short time, so that you wake up and go back to sleep again, often while you are sitting in a chair or when you do not intend to: ngủ mơ màng, thiu thiu
examples: he left his mother dozing by the fire.
geoff lay dozing gently in a sunlounger.
doze fitfullyto sleep for very short periods: ngủ chập chờn
some people managed to sleep, but most of us just dozed fitfully.
doze[cs noun] giấc ngủ mơ màng
she lapsed into a doze.

children.name: take a snooze x
children.definition: snooze/ have/ take a snooze to sleep for a short time, especially during the day when you do not usually sleep: giấc ngủ ngắn
examples: the baby was snoozing peacefully in her stroller, so we stopped to have a drink.
the study showed that if pilots on long-haul flights take a brief snooze in the cockpit, they’re more alert for the landing.

children.name: grab some sleep b1
children.definition: grab/ snatch some sleep informal to sleep for a short time when you have a chance to, because you are very busy and cannot sleep at your usual time: tranh thủ ngủ
examples: i’ll go home, snatch a couple of hours’ sleep and meet you at four.
i grabbed a little sleep on the train, but it wasn’t enough.

children.name: have a sleep b1
children.definition: have a sleep  to sleep for a short time during the day because you are tired:đi ngủ một tí
examples: are you tired? why don’t you have a sleep this afternoon?

children.name: sleep out a1
children.definition: sleep outngủ ở ngoài
examples: what i like most about camping is sleeping out.
over 100 people will be sleeping out in glasgow tonight to highlight the plight of the homeless.
bring a sleeping bag with you, because we’re going to sleep out and walk back tomorrow.

children.name: sleep rough x
children.definition: sleep rough  to sleep outside or in an empty building because you have no home or nowhere to stay:ngủ lề đường
examples: hundreds of homeless people have to sleep rough every night in london.
the number of teenagers sleeping rough on the streets is on the increase.
i was forced to sleep rough that night in a disused warehouse.

children.name: to get into your bed in order to sleep
go to bed a1
children.definition: go to bed đi ngủ
examples: do you want to go to bed, or watch the movie?
mom, do i have to go to bed right now?
she had planned to go to bed early that night, but a friend stopped by to see her.
go to bed at
i went to bed at nine last night, and i’m still tired.
go straight to bedgo to bed very shortly after doing sth else: ngủ ngay
marianne took a shower and went straight to bed.

children.name: be in bed a1
children.definition: be in bed to be lying in your bed in order to go to sleep: đang ngủ
examples: sorry, were you in bed? i thought it might be too late to call you.
i’m usually in bed by 10.30 on weekdays.
you were supposed to be in bed by now!

children.name: bedtime x
children.definition: bedtime the time when you go to bed in order to sleep: giờ đi ngủ
examples: it’s late -- it must be nearly bedtime.
lucy, 7.30 is bedtime, you know that.
this medicine should be taken at bedtime and first thing in the morning.
your bedtimethe time when you usually go to bed:
isn’t it your bedtime?
past (your) bedtimeafter the time when you normally go to bed: qua giờ đi ngủ của ai
it’s past my bedtime -- i really must get some sleep.

children.name: turn in x
children.definition: turn in informal to go to bed after you have been doing sth such as talking with other people or working for a long time:đi nghỉ
examples: come on you guys, it’s time to turn in.
i’m going to have to turn in. i’m not used to these late nights.

children.name: hit the sack x
children.definition: hit the sack/hit the hay informal to go to bed when it is very late or you are very tired:đi ngủ
examples: usually i come home, eat dinner, watch a little tv, and then hit the sack by 9:30 or 10:00
i’m bushed. i think i’ll hit the hay.

children.name: retire x
children.definition: retire formal or written to go to bed: nghỉ ngơi
examples: the captain retired at ten o'clock with a glass of whisky.
it had been a long day, so i retired early.
retire to bed
mary ellen always had to set the fire for the next morning before retiring to bed.

children.name: to make sb go to sleep
put sb to sleep b2
children.definition: put sb to sleep if sth such as music or a warm drink sends you to sleep, it relaxes you so much that you go to sleep easily:đưa ai vào giấc ngủ
examples: the sound of her rhythmic breathing finally put me to sleep, and we both slept until the sun rose.
send sb to sleep[c2] [vp] if sth such as music or a warm drink sends you to sleep, it relaxes you so much that you go to sleep easily:đưa ai vào giấc ngủ
certain types of music always send me to sleep.
‘drink this,’ mother said, ‘it’ll send you to sleep.’

children.name: get sb off to sleep x
children.definition: get sb off to sleep  to make a baby or a young child go to sleep, for example by singing to them or reading them a story:ru ngủ ai
examples: it’s sometimes very difficult to get my young son off to sleep when he’s excited.
she cried for a while but i finally got her off to sleep.

children.name: put sb to bed b2
children.definition: put sb to bed to get a baby or young child ready for the night and put them in their beds so that they will sleep:đưa ai đi ngủ
examples: usually, i put the kids to bed at about 8:00.
in those days, many children were put to bed before dark in the summer months.

children.name: go to sleep b1
children.definition: go to sleep đi ngủ
examples: are you two going to stop talking and go to sleep?
i looked over at dave, but he had gone to sleep.
he lay on the sofa and pretended to go to sleep.
go back to sleepgo to sleep again after waking up: đi ngủ tiếp
if i wake up in the night, it takes me ages to go back to sleep.

children.name: fall asleep b1
children.definition: fall asleep to go to sleep - use this especially when you do not intend to, when you go to sleep quickly, or when going to sleep has been difficult: buồn ngủ, ngủ gục
examples: dad always falls asleep in front of the tv after sunday lunch.
has monica fallen asleep yet?
i must have fallen asleep with the light on last night.
fall asleep at the wheelwhile you are driving: ngủ gục khi lái xe
one in seven road accidents is caused by drivers falling asleep at the wheel.

children.name: drop off x
children.definition: drop off  to go to sleep easily and peacefully:ngủ thiếp đi
examples: at around 12.30, she did eventually drop off for an hour or so
she kept dropping off for a few minutes, before waking with a start.
drop off to sleep
janir had dropped off to sleep on the living room couch.

children.name: nod off x
children.definition: nod off informal to go to sleep when you are sitting down, especially when you are trying hard to stay awake:ngủ gật
examples: sarah had almost nodded off when victor suddenly spoke.
as the speaker droned on, only the occasional nudge from my husband kept me from nodding off.

children.name: drift off c2
children.definition: drift off to go to sleep gradually:trôi vào giấc ngủ
examples: he must have drifted off again, for when he awoke, the train had come to a halt.
she was just starting to drift off, when she heard a scream downstairs.
drift off to sleep
that night as he drifted off to sleep, quincy tried to imagine what the day would have been like if marta had been there.

children.name: be off u
children.definition: be off  if sb, especially a baby, is off, they have started sleeping:ngủ
examples: is the baby off yet?
i always wait until he’s off before i turn the light out.

children.name: be out like a light x
children.definition: be out like a light informal to go to sleep very quickly and deeply because you are very tired:ngủ gục đi
examples: i went back to bed, and was out like a light.
after a day on the ranch, you’ll be out like a light, i can tell you.

children.name: crash out x
children.definition: crash out/ flake out informal to fall asleep very quickly, especially in a place where you do not normally sleep:ngủ gục liền
examples: ‘did you get any sleep last night?’ ‘yeah, i crashed out as soon as my head hit the pillow.’
he’d flaked out on my bed.

children.name: doze off x
children.definition: doze off informal to go to sleep when you do not intend to and sleep lightly for a short time: ngủ thiu thiu, chợp ngủ lơ mơ
examples: sorry, i must have dozed off for a few minutes.
i was just beginning to doze off when the telephone rang.

children.name: to sleep in a place where you do not usually sleep
sleep over x
children.definition: sleep over informal to sleep for one night at sb else’s house:ngủ qua đêm
examples: are your friends sleeping over tonight?
if you don't want to catch a train home at that time of night, you're welcome to sleep over.
sleep over at
is it okay if i sleep over at sam’s house tomorrow night?

children.name: crash x
children.definition: crash/crash out informal to sleep the night in a place you do not normally sleep, for example at a friend’s house or on the floor of sb’s room:ngủ qua đêm
examples: you can crash out at my place if you like.
would you mind if i crashed on your couch?
they crashed on my floor after the party.

children.name: doss x
children.definition: doss  to sleep in a place where you do not usually sleep, especially not on a proper bed:ngủ đại (ở đâu đó thay vì trên giường)
examples: the party finished late, so i just dossed on the floor at adele’s.
doss down:nằm ngủ ở đâu đó
you can stay here, if you don’t mind dossing down on the floor.

children.name: sleep a1
children.definition: sleepngủ
examples: charlotte was sleeping and her mother didn’t want to wake her.
if my snoring is that bad, i’ll go down and sleep on the sofa.
sleep (for) 2 hours/ ten minutes etc
i had slept only a few hours, but i had to get up early.
i’m so tired, i could sleep for a week
is the baby sleeping all night now?
sleep well/ badly
i didn’t sleep very well last night, so i couldn’t concentrate on the exam.
sleeping[attri adj]đang ngủ
i watched the sleeping child, the gentle rise and fall of her breast.

children.name: sleep b1
children.definition: sleep the time when you are sleeping:giờ đi ngủ
examples: eight hours’ sleep a night is enough for most people.
depression can be caused simply by a lack of sleep.
get some/ a lot/ not much etc sleep
i don’t suppose you got much sleep last night.
in your sleepwhile you are sleeping:đang ngủ
katie sometimes talks in her sleep.
grandad died peacefully in his sleep.
deep sleepa sleep that is difficult to wake up from:giấc ngủ sâu
a sudden noise on the street woke eileen from a deep sleep.

children.name: be asleep b1
children.definition: be asleep to be sleeping:thiếp đi
examples: it was nine o'clock and nicky was still asleep.
we found mom asleep on the sofa
deborah, are you asleep?
be fast/ sound asleepsleeping very well:thiếp đi nhanh chóng
by the time her father had carried her up to bed, the child was sound asleep.
the baby had been fast asleep ever since we arrived.
be half asleepnearly asleep:gần như thiếp đi
the old man was half asleep and barely able to respond to the policeman’s questions.

children.name: get some sleep b1
children.definition: get some sleep/catch up on some sleep to sleep after a period of time when you have not been able to sleep because of illness, worry, work etc:ngủ được một ít
examples: you must stop worrying and try to get some sleep.
i’ll have to finish the job, but i can catch up on some sleep tomorrow night.

children.name: have a kip/get some kip x
children.definition: have a kip/ get some kip  to sleep, especially when you are very tired and you need to sleep:đi ngủ
examples: you can have a kip in the car on the way.
there’s nothing worse than other people around when you’re trying to get some kip.

children.name: slumber x
children.definition: slumber writtensleep - used especially inliterature:giấc ngủ thiu thiu
examples: he had fallen into a deep slumber by the fire.
the giants awoke from their enchanted slumber.
slumber[i verb]thiu thiu ngủ
coleridge wrote the line ‘my cradled infant slumbers peacefully’ after the death of his son.

children.name: to sleep for longer than usual
sleep in x
children.definition: sleep in/lie in/have a lie-in  to deliberately sleep until a later time than usual, and get up late:ngủ nướng
examples: where are diane and mike? sleeping in again, huh?
there’s not much chance of a lie-in when you’ve got three kids.
we had a lie-in and breakfast in bed.

children.name: sleep off x
children.definition: sleep off to sleep for a long time, in order to stop feeling the effects of alcohol, drugs etc:ngủ cho hết say
examples: sleep sth off/ sleep off sth:
in the end i decided the best thing was to put you to bed and let you sleep it off.
martin’s still in bed, sleeping off his hangover.
he was taken to the local hospital and kept in overnight to sleep off the effects of the drug.

children.name: yawn b1
children.definition: yawn to open the mouth wide and take a lot of air into the lungs and slowly send it out, usually when tired or bored : ngáp
examples: i can't stop yawning - i must be tired.
alan stretched and yawned.
yawn[ c ] an act of yawning
her eyes watered as she tried tostifle(= stop) a yawn.
kay shook her head andstifled a yawn(= tried to stop yawning).

children.name: sleepwalker x
children.definition: sleepwalker a person who gets out of bed and walks around while they are sleeping : người mộng du; người miên hành
examples: she, her two older sisters and her nephew had all been sleepwalkers.
sleepwalk[ i ] mộng du
apparently, people who sleepwalk often make for the wardrobe
sleepwalking[ u ] chứng mộng du

children.name: snore b2
children.definition: snore to breathe in a very noisy way while you are sleeping: ngáy
examples: sometimes my husband snores so loudly, it keeps me awake at night.
do you know any cures for snoring?
snore[ c ] a very noisy breath while you are sleeping
i could hear loud snores coming from jim's bedroom.
snorer[ c ]
he's a terrible snorer.

children.name: somnambulist x
children.definition: somnambulist  sb who walks while they are asleep: người mộng du; người miên hành
examples: somnambulism[ u ] [specialized] the action, sometimes happening regularly, of a person walking around while they are sleeping : chứng mộng du; chứng miên hành
